title: Ticket #5040: condor_gpu_discover -config should set count of GPUs
description:
It can be hard to configure a execute node to create GPU slots from a variable number of GPUs. condor_gpu_discovery could be called as a script in the config file, if it were to set a config macro to the number of GPUs detected, then this job would be easier.

currently condor_gpu_discovery -config sets a config macro to the list of ids of the GPUs detected, it should also set NUM_DETECTED_GPUs to the number of items in the list.
remarks:
2015-May-06 10:14:32 by johnkn:
condor_gpu_discovery -config now returns 

    DetectedGPUs=CUDA0, CUDA1, CUDA2
    NUM_DETECTED_GPUs=3

If it detects 3 CUDA GPUs. So you can add this to your config 

    include : $(LIBEXEC)/condor_gpu_discovery -config |
    NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_1 = 1
    SLOT_TYPE_1_PARTITIONABLE = true
    NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_2 = $(NUM_DETECTED_GPUS)
    SLOT_TYPE_2 = GPUs=1, CPUs=2, Mem=500, Disk=1/$(DETECTED_CORES)

This will give 1 static slot per GPU, and one partitionable slot that has all of the remaining resources.
